param.name: appliance_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

method.name: POST
method.doc: To create a FIDO2 Relying Party, issue an HTTP POST command on the relying parties resource URI.
Note: For the change to take effect, it must be deployed as described in the Configuration changes commit process.

param.name: Authorization: Basic
param.doc: Basic authentication header.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service.

param.name: id
param.doc: An optional, custom ID to represent the FIDO2 Relying Party. Automatically assigned if not included.

param.name: name
param.doc: The display name of the FIDO2 Relying Party.

param.name: rpId
param.doc: The Relying Party ID. It is a valid domain string that uniquely identifies the FIDO2 Relying Party.

param.name: fidoServerOptions
param.doc: The FIDO2 Server configuration options.

param.name: relyingPartyOptions
param.doc: The FIDO2 Relying Party configuration options.

param.name: origins
param.doc: A list of origins that can be used for attestation and authentication. The RP ID must be equal to the origin's effective domain, or a registrable domain suffix of the origin's effective domain. The origin's scheme must be https. The origin's port may be included but ensure it is unrestricted. The Origin entry in the signed payload indicates where a request originates from. It doesn't include any path information, but only the server name. Each origin entry here will be compared to the Origin entry in the signed payload contents and will fail validation if the supplied Origin does not exist in this list.

param.name: metadataSet
param.doc: A list of FIDO2 Metadata ID's that this FIDO2 Relying Party will support. Can be empty to indicate no metadata is associated with this FIDO2 Relying Party.

param.name: metadataSoftFail
param.doc: True if an attestation should "soft-fail" if metadata is not present or does not match any metadata that is present in metadataSet.

param.name: mediatorMappingRuleId
param.doc: The ID of the mediator mapping-rule assigned to this FIDO2 Relying Party. The absence of this field will result in mediation being disabled.

param.name: attestation
param.doc: The FIDO2 attestation configuration options for this FIDO2 Relying Party.

param.name: android-safetynet
param.doc: The Android SafetyNet Statement Format options. Required if "android-safetynet" is included in the list of "statementFormats".

param.name: impersonationGroup
param.doc: The Verify Access group used for acting on another users behalf for attestation and assertion ceremonies.

param.name: webauthnSpecEnforcement
param.doc: True if WebAuthn Specification Enforcement is enabled. The WebAuthn Spec enforces user presence as a requirement during attestation and assertion. Default is enabled.

param.name: statementTypes
param.doc: A list of permitted attestation statement types for this FIDO2 Relying Party. Valid values are "basic", "self", "attCA", "anonCA", and "none".

param.name: statementFormats
param.doc: A list of permitted attestation statement formats for this FIDO2 Relying Party. Valid values are "fido-u2f", "packed", "tpm", "android-key", "android-safetynet", and "none".

param.name: publicKeyAlgorithms
param.doc: A list of accepted public key algorithms for this FIDO2 Relying Party. Valid values are "SHA256withECDSA", "SHA384withECDSA", "SHA512withECDSA", "SHA1withRSA", "SHA256withRSA", "SHA384withRSA", "SHA512withRSA" and "Ed25519".

param.name: attestationMaxAge
param.doc: The maximum age in milliseconds of an attestation using the Android SafetyNet Statement Format.

param.name: clockSkew
param.doc: The amount of allowed variance in milliseconds when validating from the Google servers reported time of statement generation.
